portfolioSection.professionalSummary: Master's student at Portland State University in Computer Science with focus areas in Cybersecurity, AI, and Software Engineering. Experienced in Python automation/development and ServiceNow software development, delivering measurable impact through intelligent, secure, and scalable systems.

servicenow.name: ServiceNow AI Inventory
servicenow.description: Partnered with compliance and AI teams to architect a ServiceNow-based AI inventory system with custom data models and import automation. Leveraged Agile boards to manage tasks, tested client scripts/UI Policies, and deployed iteratively in sync with ServiceNow SDLC workflows. Result: Now all data inventory for AI business applications within the company are stored and managed within this system.

cpadmin.name: CPAdmin Page Enhancement
cpadmin.description: Worked cross-functionally with platform and frontend teams to redesign CPAdmin using JSBootstrap and Java; enabled configuration edits for Kubernetes assignments in Aladdin apps. Integrated unit tests across frontend and backend logic. Result: Enabled all developers throughout the company to configure data for running applications and scripts on servers deployed on Kubernetes.

filenameEncoder.name: Filename Encoder App
filenameEncoder.description: Co-developed a production-grade Python tool with Private Markets engineers to URL-encode filenames for secure internal file transfers; followed Agile sprints, wrote unit tests, and deployed via CI/CD pipelines. Result: Allowed private markets team members to easily access market data without the bottleneck of incorrect filename formats.

cusip.name: CUSIP Fund Retriever
cusip.description: Built a Python + SQL reporting tool during onboarding to retrieve CUSIP fund data and auto-distribute reports via email. Collaborated with mentors for feedback, applied script-level unit testing.

blackrock2.title: Analyst, Technology Support
blackrock2.description: Performed troubleshooting for various software and hardware issues across internal teams for better user experience for all employees in the firm. Provided OS testing and user support for 2,000+ employees.

businessImpact.name: Business Impact Simulator
businessImpact.description: Building an AI-powered application that first classifies a project into the appropriate industry area(s) based on its descriptions, papers, and documents, then uses analytical and intelligence-based tools to generate both textual and graphical narratives of the project's impact on real or hypothetical companies, including long-term, industry-level effects.

retailImpact.name: Retail Impact Simulator - Cloud-Based Application
retailImpact.description: Developed a scalable cloud-native application deployed on Google Cloud Run using microservices architecture with Docker containerization and REST API integrations. Built backend server with API-first design principles that coordinates specialized analysis agents gathering data from multiple external APIs.

directoryChallenge.name: Directory Try Hack Me Challenge
directoryChallenge.description: Successfully completed a cybersecurity challenge focused on directory traversal vulnerabilities and web application security. Demonstrated proficiency in identifying and exploiting path traversal vulnerabilities, understanding web server configurations, and implementing secure coding practices. This project showcases hands-on experience with penetration testing methodologies and security assessment techniques.
